newsitem.title: TAIWAN: China Development up on electronics rise.
newsitem.headline: China Development up on electronics rise.

text.p: Taiwan's leading venture capital and investment firm, China Development Corp, rose in late Friday trade, reflecting a recent surge in electronics, where the firm is heavily invested, brokers said.
With 32 minutes left, China Development was up T$3.5 or three percent to T$120.5 and was among the top three most heavily trade shares.
"As electronics have risen so sharply recently, China Development, which can be seen as a half-electronic share, surely will benefit," said HSBC James Capel analyst Alex Chen.
In early May, China Development said that as of March 31, it had invested in 154 local companies with a total investment of T$20.93 billion.

It said its top investment targets were the semiconductor industry, electronic and electrical appliance industry, and computer and telecommunications, which accounted for 22.88 percent, 12.66 percent and 11.44 percent, respectively, of total investment.
